result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrell J Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, credit for 62 days, Huber privileges for work, school and AODA treatment and work crew.

Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence.
Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 3/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment including therapy, counseling and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
No drivers license suspension.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrell J Bates

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrell J Bates in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Montrell J Bates in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 62 days, Huber privileges for work, school, AODA treatment and work crew. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on  PROBATION or a period of 2 YEARS.   Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment including, therapy, counseling and taking any prescribed medications.
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Complete 10 hours of community service
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 3/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
**Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Montrell J Bates in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Montrell J Bates in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on return of doctor's report. Parties are stipulating to the finding of competency in the doctor's report. Court finds the defendant competent to proceed. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 3/13/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 4/13/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Montrell J Bates not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense raised competency on 2-9-15 before Br. 4 in defendant's other pending matter.  Court will use the report that will be generated in Br. 4 on or about 2-23-15.  Case adjourned for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Montrell J Bates not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 2/16/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Requesting Competency Evaluation received and filed. sab

Defendant Montrell J Bates in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Montrell J Bates in custody.  Karl Hayes for David J. Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Montrell J Bates in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Montrell J Bates in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
